    "let @xmath5 denote the coxeter group of type @xmath6 on @xmath7 , also known as the hyperoctahedral group .",
    "this is the group of signed permutations @xmath8 on @xmath7 , with the requirement that @xmath9 .",
    "for ease of notation , a negative sign will be written beneath an integer , rather than before it .",
    "an element @xmath10 will be written @xmath11 , where @xmath8 maps @xmath12 ( and @xmath13 ) .",
    "notice that the element @xmath8 is completely determined by the values of @xmath14 .",
    "the group @xmath5 is generated by the transpositions @xmath15 , which satisfy the coxeter relations :    @xmath16    a map is written to the left of its input , meaning that for @xmath17 , the product @xmath18 changes the positions of the values @xmath19 and @xmath20 ( and @xmath21 and @xmath22 ) in @xmath8 , whereas @xmath23 changes the values in positions @xmath19 and @xmath20 in @xmath8 .",
    "the transposition @xmath24 changes the sign of the first entry , so @xmath25 interchanges @xmath26 and @xmath27 in @xmath8 , and @xmath28",
    ". an extensive treatment of coxeter groups can be found in @xcite .",
    "every element in @xmath5 can be written as a product of the transpositions @xmath29 .",
    "the minimum number of transpositions required for a product to equal @xmath8 is the _ length _ of @xmath8 , denoted @xmath30 .",
    "the _ longest element _ in @xmath5 is @xmath31 , and @xmath32 .",
    "a _ reduced decomposition _ for an element @xmath8 of length @xmath33 is a string @xmath34 such that @xmath35 .",
    "the set @xmath36 consists of all reduced decompositions of @xmath8 .",
    "a consecutive substring of a reduced decomposition is a _",
    "factor_. for any @xmath37 , a factor of the form @xmath38 or @xmath39 in a reduced decomposition will be called a _ yang - baxter move _ , and a factor @xmath2 or @xmath3 will be called a _ 01 move_.    the symmetric group @xmath40 of unsigned permutations is the coxeter group of type @xmath41 .",
    "it is generated by the transpositions @xmath42 , which are subject to the relations in equations  - .",
    "the longest element in @xmath40 is @xmath43 , which has length @xmath44 . in @xcite",
    ", reiner computes the following somewhat surprising result .",
    "[ reinerthm ] the expected number of yang - baxter moves in a reduced decomposition of @xmath45 is @xmath27 for all @xmath46 .",
    "this paper presents results for coxeter groups of type @xmath6 that are analogous to theorem  [ reinerthm ] . in type @xmath41 ,",
    "the expectation of factors corresponding to the coxeter relation in equation   was computed . for the hyperoctahedral group",
    ", factors corresponding to the coxeter relations in each of equations   and   will be treated .",
    "theorem  [ e(x)thm ] calculates that the expected number of yang - baxter moves in a reduced decomposition of @xmath47 is @xmath48 , and theorem  [ e(y)thm ] shows that the expected number of @xmath49 moves is @xmath50 . unlike reiner s result , both of these expectations are dependent upon @xmath51 .",
    "moreover , in the context of theorem  [ reinerthm ] , the value @xmath48 seems quite plausible since the length of @xmath47 is approximately twice that of @xmath45 .    a variety of tools are used to prove theorems  [ e(x)thm ] and  [ e(y)thm ] , several of which",
    "are discussed in section 2 .",
    "section 3 computes the expected number of yang - baxter moves in elements of @xmath52 , and section 4 does the same for @xmath49 moves .",
    "in @xcite , stanley shows that for a vexillary element @xmath53 , @xmath54 where @xmath55 is the number of standard young tableaux of a particular shape @xmath56 . this result is central to the proof of theorem  [ reinerthm ] .",
    "there are numerous definitions of vexillarity in type @xmath41 , for example see @xcite and @xcite .",
    "one definition is that @xmath57 is vexillary if it is @xmath58-avoiding .",
    "billey and lam define a notion of vexillary for type @xmath6 in @xcite .",
    "their definition is in terms of stanley symmetric functions and schur @xmath59-functions , and they prove its equivalence with a statement about pattern avoidance , now of signed permutations .",
    "this latter statement will be given as the definition here , and it follows from the work of billey and lam that it generalizes equation   to type @xmath6 in the appropriate way .    an element @xmath10 is _",
    "vexillary for type @xmath6 _ if @xmath11 avoids the following patterns :    @xmath60    note that patterns in signed permutations must maintain their signs .",
    "for example , @xmath61 is not an instance of the pattern @xmath62 , even though @xmath63 .",
    "@xmath64 is vexillary for type @xmath6 , but @xmath65 is not .",
    "to each element @xmath10 , billey and lam define a shifted shape @xmath66 as follows .",
    "[ shapealg ] let @xmath67 .    1 .   write @xmath68 in increasing order and call this @xmath69 .",
    "2 .   let @xmath53 be the ( vexillary ) permutation @xmath70 .",
    "3 .   let @xmath71 be the partition with ( distinct ) parts @xmath72 .",
    "4 .   let @xmath73 be any standard shifted young tableau of shape @xmath71 , and let @xmath74 be any standard young tableau whose shape is the transpose of the partition with parts @xmath75 , where @xmath76 5 .",
    "embed @xmath73 in the shifted shape @xmath77",
    "fill in the rest of @xmath78 with @xmath79 starting from the rightmost column and labeling each column from bottom to top .",
    "this gives the tableau @xmath80 .",
    "obtain @xmath81 by adding @xmath82 to each entry of @xmath74 , and glue @xmath80 to the left side of @xmath81 to obtain @xmath83 .",
    "delete the box containing @xmath84 from @xmath83 .",
    "if the remaining tableau is not shifted , apply jeu de taquin to fill in the box .",
    "do likewise for the box containing @xmath85 , then @xmath86 , and so on , stopping after procedure for the box containing @xmath87 .",
    "the ( shifted ) shape of the resulting tableau is @xmath66 .",
    ". then @xmath89 , @xmath90 , @xmath91 , and the tableau @xmath74 has shape @xmath92 .",
    "five boxes of @xmath78 will be filled by primed numbers , and the final tableau has shifted shape @xmath93 .",
    "[ redtab ] if @xmath10 is vexillary for type @xmath6 , then @xmath94 where @xmath95 is the number of standard tableaux of shifted shape @xmath66 .",
    "equation   will play an analogous role in the proofs of this paper to that played by equation   in @xcite .",
    "hooks and hook - lengths for shifted shapes will also be important tools , as they facilitate the calculation of @xmath95 .",
    "recall the hook - length formula for straight shapes ( see @xcite for a more extensive treatment ) .    for a shape @xmath96 , @xmath97 where @xmath98 is the number of squares in @xmath99 that are in the same column as @xmath100 but no higher , or in the same row as @xmath100 but no farther to the left .",
    "there is an analogous formula for shifted shapes ( for more information , see @xcite ) .",
    "[ bhook ] for a shifted shape @xmath101 , @xmath102 where @xmath103 is the total number of the squares in @xmath104 that are    1 .   in the same column as @xmath100 but no higher ; 2 .   in the same row as @xmath100 but no farther to the left ; or 3 .   in the @xmath105st row of @xmath104 if @xmath100 is in the @xmath106th column of @xmath104 .",
    "the final preliminary to proving the main results of this paper is the following lemma .",
    "the proof is straightforward and omitted here .",

    "<S> the expected number of @xmath2 or @xmath3 factors appearing in a reduced decomposition is @xmath4 . </S>"
